Sentencas: An ultra-fine samaria-doped ceria (Ce0.8Sm0.2O1.9, SDC) electrolyte prepared by a non-ion selective EDTA-citric complexing method is developed herein for intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells (IT-SOFCs).
Titulo: Synthesis and properties of samaria-doped ceria electrolyte for IT-SOFCs by EDTA-citrate complexing method

Sentencas: The rigid agglomerates due to organic compounds that exist in the SDC precursors during the EDTA-citrate complexing synthesis process inhibit crystalline growth and grain growth, leading to the generation of ultra-fine grain following the sintering procedure.
Titulo: Synthesis and properties of samaria-doped ceria electrolyte for IT-SOFCs by EDTA-citrate complexing method

Sentencas: Calcination is necessary above 500 degrees C for all precursors.
Titulo: Synthesis and properties of samaria-doped ceria electrolyte for IT-SOFCs by EDTA-citrate complexing method

Sentencas: The average grain size of the pellets after sintering at 1400 degrees C for 2 h is submicron in scale (from 200 nm to 600 nm) with various pH values, and the pellets are smaller than those obtained from other synthesis processes.
Titulo: Synthesis and properties of samaria-doped ceria electrolyte for IT-SOFCs by EDTA-citrate complexing method

Sentencas: Dense pellets with pH values of 10 (relative density of 99%) are obtained with precursor powder calcination at 900 degrees C for 3 h. Electrical conductivity is dependent on the calcination temperature and pH value of the solution, and the maximum electrical conductivity is 0.01 S cm(-1) at 700 degrees C with a pH value of 10.
Titulo: Synthesis and properties of samaria-doped ceria electrolyte for IT-SOFCs by EDTA-citrate complexing method
Synthesis and properties of samaria-doped ceria electrolyte for IT-SOFCs by EDTA-citrate complexing method
Synthesis and properties of samaria-doped ceria electrolyte for IT-SOFCs by EDTA-citrate complexing method
